Class GameServer

java.lang.Object
system.GameServer
public class GameServer extends Object
The server holds a Vector of sockets, representing each client connected to it. The server allows the controller to communicate to each connected client, and send/receive packets.
Since:
23

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    private class 
    GameServer.ClientHandler
    Private inner class that handles incoming packets from clients.

    connectedPlayers
    The list of sockets connected to each client/player.
    private GameControllerListener
    listener
    Listener interface for forwarding game-related events to the controller.
    private int
    nextClientId
    Auto-incrementing ID assigned to the next connecting client.
    private int
    numHumanOpponents
    The number of human (non-AI) opponents expected in the game.
    private ServerSocket
    serverSocket
    The server socket that listens for incoming client connections.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameServer

      public GameServer(int port, GameControllerListener listener, int maxPlayers) throws IOException
      Initializes a new Server and starts listening for packets on the socket.
      Parameters:
      port - that the socket should listen on
      listener - allows the server to call methods based on received packets.
      maxPlayers - the max no of players
      Throws:
      IOException - if the input/output is interrupted
      Since:
      23

  • Method Details

    • acceptConnections

      public void acceptConnections()
      Starts the acceptThread which is what the server uses to listen for incoming connections from clients. Once the number of connected clients matches the number of clients that the server is waiting for, the server alerts the listener to start the game.
      Since:
      23

    • broadcastChat

      public void broadcastChat(String msg)
      Broadcasts a chat send from a client to all connected clients.
      Parameters:
      msg - The chat message to be broadcast.
      Since:
      23

    • broadcastConsoleMsg

      public void broadcastConsoleMsg(String optName, String msg, String optCard)
      Broadcasts a console message (game notification) to all connected clients.
      Parameters:
      optName - : some console messages have an optional name section.
      msg - : the main contents of the console message.
      optCard - : some console messages have an optional card section.
      Since:
      23

    • broadcastRoundWinner

      public void broadcastRoundWinner(String winnerName)
      Broadcasts the round winner to all connected clients.
      Parameters:
      winnerName - name of winner
      Since:
      23

    • broadcastGameWinners

      public void broadcastGameWinners(String winnerNames)
      Broadcasts the game winner(s) to all connected clients.
      Parameters:
      winnerNames - names of winners
      Since:
      23

    • requestSuitChoice

      public void requestSuitChoice(int clientId, String cardToPlay)
      Requests that the client who played an Eight choose a suit for the Eight via a JDialog.
      Parameters:
      clientId - : the client who's turn it currently is.
      cardToPlay - : The true card (read: suit) of the eight. This is needed for game logic reasons.
      Since:
      23

    • broadCastButtonMode

      public void broadCastButtonMode(String mode)
      The UI should have a certain combination of buttons enabled/disabled based on a given "state"; is the user idle, with no game running? Are they playing a single player game, or multiplayer? The buttons are in different configs for each state.
      Parameters:
      mode - : which button mode the UI should be configured for.
      Since:
      23

    • closeSocket

      public void closeSocket(int index)
      Tells the "client" (read: socket) at the passed index to shutdown. Its receive thread is interrupted and its UI is reset to default.
      Parameters:
      index - the index to close socket
      Since:
      23

    • terminateGame

      public void terminateGame()
      Tell each connected client to reset their UI to the default state.
      Since:
      23

    • terminateThreads

      public void terminateThreads()
      Terminates (interrupts) the receiveThread of each connected client, then does the same for the host's acceptThread.
      Since:
      23

    • getConnectedClients

      public Vector<Socket> getConnectedClients()
      Getter for the vector of connected clients (their sockets).
      Returns:
      connected clients
      Since:
      23

    • requestViewRefresh

      public void requestViewRefresh(Vector<Player> players, Card lastPlayedCard, boolean turnDirection)
      Requests that each client refresh their view. A "view refresh" is basically an update of each component in the UI that *could* have a new value (hands, last played card, player scores, etc.).
      Parameters:
      players - : the list of players, passed from the model.
      lastPlayedCard - : the last played (discarded) card.
      turnDirection - : clockwise/counterclockwise (normal vs. reversed)
      Since:
      23

    • shutdown

      public void shutdown()
      Closes the socket of each connected client.
      Since:
      23

    • getClientCount

      public int getClientCount()
      Returns the number of connected clients.
      Returns:
      client count
      Since:
      23

    • getClientNames

      public Vector<String> getClientNames()
      Returns the Vector of client names.
      Returns:
      client names
      Since:
      23
